intro: Robiquetia discolor, commonly known as the variable daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to pink, depending on environmental conditions. Its leaves are typically alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Robiquetia discolor thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
